Description: Pottery ring askos (jug) with a ring shaped body, rather straight, strap handle, vertical neck and a flaring, flat-topped rim; fragments now missing from the rim; largely covered in calcareous deposit; fine buff clay. Remains of dull glaze on all of upper part; lower half of body and underside reserved.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GO.060)
